title: Codegen: classes (struct/impl/new)
description: Compile user-defined Haxe classes to Rust: emit struct for instance fields and impl block for methods + constructor (new).
acceptance_criteria: Generated Rust for a simple class compiles with cargo build.
close_reason: Emitted user classes as Rust struct + impl with constructor (new) and instance methods using HxRef.

title: Local issue
description: desc

title: Rust AST: struct/impl + printer
description: Extend RustAST + RustASTPrinter to represent/print Rust struct items and impl blocks (incl. methods).
acceptance_criteria: Rust output renders a struct + impl with a simple method and cargo fmt check passes on generated code.
close_reason: Implemented RustAST struct/impl nodes + RustASTPrinter support.

title: Roadmap: reflaxe.rust milestones (0–10)
description:
Tracks the milestone plan from `prd.md` (section 8).

Scope: Haxe 4.3.7 → Rust target built on Reflaxe with an AST-first pipeline (Builder → Transformer → Printer) and a Rust runtime crate (hxrt).

Primary outputs: haxelib + generated Cargo project (portable mode default; rust-native mode opt-in).

title: Milestone 0 — Project skeleton + compiler registration
description:
Deliverables:
- `haxelib.json`, `extraParams.hxml`
- `CompilerBootstrap.Start()` and `CompilerInit.Start()`
- `RustCompiler` registered via `ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler(...)`
- `RustInjection.__rust__` macro shim
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe build with `-lib reflaxe.rust` and `-D rust_output=out` triggers the compiler
- Output directory receives at least one generated file (stub is OK)
close_reason: Milestone 0 complete: haxelib skeleton + bootstrap/init registration + __rust__ shim + stub output.

title: Scaffold haxelib layout + build entrypoints
description:
- Create initial directory layout (`src/`, `std/`, `runtime/` placeholders)
- Add `haxelib.json` + `extraParams.hxml` to auto-register macros
- Ensure `-lib reflaxe.rust` loads correctly
close_reason: Scaffolded haxelib (haxelib.json + extraParams.hxml), vendored reflaxe, added examples + runtime placeholder.

title: Implement CompilerBootstrap.Start (classpath + gating)
description:
- Inject target classpaths early (`std/`, target src)
- Gate activation via `Context.defined("rust_output")` (and/or target.name==rust)
close_reason: Added CompilerBootstrap.Start() to inject vendored reflaxe + std/ only when -D rust_output (or target.name==rust).

title: Implement CompilerInit.Start (compiler registration)
description:
- Register `RustCompiler` via `ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler(...)`
- Configure output extension `.rs`, output dir define `rust_output`, `__rust__` injection name
close_reason: Implemented CompilerInit.Start(): registers RustCompiler via ReflectCompiler.AddCompiler and wires rust_output + __rust__ injection.

title: Add RustInjection.__rust__ macro shim
description:
- Provide `reflaxe.rust.macros.RustInjection.__rust__(code,args)`
- Emit `macro untyped __rust__($a{...})` so typing succeeds; codegen handles later
close_reason: Added reflaxe.rust.macros.RustInjection.__rust__ macro shim (untyped __rust__ call for Reflaxe injection).

title: Emit stub output so rust_output gets files
description:
- Minimal OutputIterator path that writes at least one `.rs` file into `-D rust_output` dir
- OK to be a hardcoded stub initially (proves plumbing)
close_reason: Compiler now emits a minimal Cargo project (Cargo.toml + src/main.rs) into -D rust_output.

title: Milestone 9 — Rust-native API layer (crate interop + ergonomics)
description:
Deliverables:
- Cargo dependency registry + `Cargo.toml` generation
- `rust.*` externs + helper macros
- Improved `__rust__` injection (prefer AST emission when possible)
acceptance_criteria: - Example project declares `serde` dep and uses derive/injection to serialize successfully

title: Milestone 10 — Performance + idiomatic mode optimizations
description:
Deliverables:
- Optional `-D rust_native` / `-D rust_idiomatic` mode
- Arrays → `Vec<T>` when semantics allow
- Reduce clones in hot paths
- Better loop lowering to iterators
- Optional `rustfmt` integration (`-D rustfmt`)
- Compilation output determinism guarantees
acceptance_criteria:
- Benchmarks show measurable improvements on representative workloads
- Output stays readable and stable across runs

title: Milestone 1 — Rust AST + printer + OutputIterator hello world
description:
Deliverables:
- Minimal `RustAST` node set
- `RustASTPrinter` with deterministic formatting
- `RustOutputIterator` that prints AST to `.rs`
- Generate minimal Cargo project (`Cargo.toml`, `src/main.rs` or `src/lib.rs`)
acceptance_criteria:
- Compiles a trivial `Main.main()` that does `trace("hi")`
- `cargo build` succeeds for generated project
- Running the binary prints sensible output (trace may be stubbed to `println!`)
close_reason: Milestone 1 complete: Rust AST + transformer+printer + output iterator; emits Cargo.toml + src/main.rs; smoke compiled/runs.

title: Define minimal RustAST node set
description:
- Add core nodes for items, stmts, exprs, and types needed for hello-world
- Keep representation small; extend only as codegen needs grow
close_reason: Added minimal Rust AST types in src/reflaxe/rust/ast/RustAST.hx (functions, stmts, exprs, types).

title: Implement RustASTPrinter (deterministic formatting)
description:
- Print a minimal module with functions/blocks/exprs
- Ensure output is stable across runs (ordering, whitespace)
close_reason: Implemented deterministic Rust printer in src/reflaxe/rust/ast/RustASTPrinter.hx (rustfmt-clean for snapshots).

title: Implement RustOutputIterator (Cargo project + .rs files)
description:
- Write per-module `.rs` output
- Generate `Cargo.toml` + entrypoint (`src/main.rs` or `src/lib.rs`)
- Wire module tree (`mod.rs`/`pub mod`) as needed
close_reason: Implemented RustOutputIterator + extra Cargo.toml emission (BaseCompiler.setExtraFile) and main.rs routing to rust_output/src/main.rs.

title: End-to-end hello-world compile + cargo build smoke
description:
- Compile a trivial Haxe `Main.main()` that uses `trace("hi")`
- Ensure generated project `cargo build` succeeds and runs
close_reason: Verified end-to-end: examples/hello compiles to Cargo project and  prints output.

title: Milestone 2 — Typed expression coverage (core subset)
description:
Deliverables (compileExpression coverage):
- constants: null/int/float/bool/string
- locals, vars, let-binding
- calls, method calls
- blocks
- if/else
- return
- basic binops: + - * / == != < <= > >= && ||
- unary ops: ! -
- simple field access (no inheritance yet)
acceptance_criteria:
- Snapshot tests compile and produce rustfmt-clean output for:
  - arithmetic
  - string concatenation
  - if/else branching
  - local variables and assignments
close_reason: Milestone 2 complete: core expression subset + snapshot harness.

title: Expressions: literals + locals + assignments
description:
- Emit RustAST for null/int/float/bool/string
- Support local var decls, reads, and basic assignment
close_reason: Implemented literals/locals/var decls/assignment compilation in RustCompiler (TConst/TLocal/TVar/OpAssign).

title: Expressions: unary + binary ops
description:
- Implement `!` and unary `-`
- Implement core binops: + - * /, comparisons, &&/||
- Decide and document string concatenation strategy (portable mode first)
close_reason: Implemented unary/binary ops (+,-,*,/, comparisons, &&/||, !, -) + string concat lowering to format!("{}{}").

title: Control flow: blocks, if/else, return
description:
- Compile blocks as Rust `{ ... }`
- Lower if/else expressions/statements correctly
- Handle returns (unit vs value)
close_reason: Implemented blocks (tail expr), if/else, and return lowering in RustCompiler.

title: Calls: function calls, method calls, simple field access
description:
- Support calls and method calls for simple cases
- Support instance field access (no inheritance yet)
close_reason: Implemented TCall/TField lowering incl. haxe.Log.trace -> println!, static/instance field access, and same-class static calls.

title: Snapshot test harness for generated Rust
description:
- Add a minimal snapshot structure (`test/snapshot/<case>/...`)
- Harness compiles Haxe → Rust and diffs output
- Optional: run rustfmt in CI-like mode when available
close_reason: Added snapshot harness (test/run-snapshots.sh) with cases covering arithmetic, string concat, if/else, return; outputs rustfmt-clean.

title: Milestone 3 — Data model: classes, fields, constructors, methods
description:
Deliverables:
- `ClassBuilder` emits `struct` + `impl` methods + constructor (`new`)
- Portable allocation strategy: `Rc<RefCell<T>>` (via runtime alias like `HxRef<T>`)
- Field reads/writes use short borrow scopes
acceptance_criteria:
- Haxe class with fields + methods compiles and runs correctly
- No borrow-checker errors in generated Rust for simple usage patterns
close_reason: Milestone 3 complete: structs/impls + HxRef instance model + class snapshot/example.

title: Milestone 4 — Enums + switch → match
description:
Deliverables:
- `EnumBuilder` emits Rust `enum` variants (tuple variants for args)
- `SwitchBuilder` lowering:
  - enum switch → `match`
  - int/string switch → `match`
  - fallback to if-chain when patterns don't map cleanly
acceptance_criteria:
- Typical Haxe enum ADT example compiles
- Generated Rust uses `match` idiomatically for enum switching

title: Milestone 5 — Interfaces + inheritance (portable semantics first)
description:
Deliverables:
- Traits for interfaces and base-class polymorphism
- Trait impls for `RefCell<Concrete>`
- Accessors for polymorphic field/property access
- Basic RTTI: stable type ids + `__hx_type_id()`
acceptance_criteria:
- Base-typed variable calling overridden method dispatches correctly
- Interface-typed variable works
- Simple `Std.isOfType` works (even partial)

title: Milestone 6 — Exceptions and try/catch
description:
Deliverables:
- `hxrt::exception` with thread-local payload + panic id mechanism
- Codegen for `throw`
- `try/catch` lowering via `catch_unwind` helper
acceptance_criteria:
- Example that throws/catches values behaves as expected
- Nested try/catch works

title: Milestone 7 — Haxe stdlib Tier 1 support
description:
Tier 1 targets:
- `Std` (stringify/parse/isOfType stub)
- `Type` (typeof/enum helpers/getClassName minimal)
- `Reflect` (field get/set minimal)
- `haxe.ds.Option`, `haxe.functional.Result` idiomatic mapping
- `haxe.io.Bytes` backed by `Vec<u8>`
- Iterators needed for `for` loops

Deliverables:
- Minimal `std/` overrides where needed
- `hxrt` modules backing these APIs
acceptance_criteria: - Snapshot suite of stdlib-focused examples compiles and runs

title: Milestone 8 — sys package and IO
description:
Deliverables:
- Support core `sys.*` via Rust `std`:
  - `sys.io.File`, `sys.io.FileInput`/`FileOutput`
  - `sys.FileSystem`, `Sys`
acceptance_criteria:
- Read/write file example works
- Directory listing works
- Basic CLI args and exit codes work

title: Lowering: class instances (HxRef field/method)
description: Lower new/field access/method calls for class instances using portable HxRef (Rc<RefCell<T>>) and short borrow scopes.
acceptance_criteria: No borrow-checker errors for simple field reads/writes and method calls.
close_reason: Lowered new/field access/method calls for class instances using HxRef + borrow-safe assignment blocks.

title: Tests: class snapshot + example
description: Add a snapshot test + example project that compiles and runs a Haxe class with fields + methods.
acceptance_criteria: Snapshot compiles, rustfmt check passes, and cargo run prints expected output.
close_reason: Added class snapshot + example; snapshots compile, rustfmt clean, and cargo run produces expected output.
